channel.title: Need a bit of help
channel.description:
"Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:
Name: 1 IP address: 2 TCP Ports to open: 43594 UDP Ports to open: Inbound Filter: Allow All Schedule: Always"
...I need help with this part of the tutorial. When I type my router IP in the address bar, it takes me to a Google search. I need to do this part badly, or else no one will be able to get on my server! :eek:[br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2007, 07:26:31 PM[/size][hr]please

item.title: Need a bit of help
item.dc:creator: @davyn729 davyn729
item.description:
@davyn729 wrote:

EDIT: I’m logged into the IP, but now what do I do? I don’t see the “Advanced” option like the tutorial says…[br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2007, 10:38:12 PM[/size][hr]ok i don’t need any help now!

Read full topic

@cccrrraaazzziii wrote:

If you have your IP from your router, just paste it into the address bar, it should load up then.

item.description:
@justlikers wrote:

type http://??.???.??.?/ fill the question marks in with ur ip and make sure you ADD A SLASH AT THE END. this same thing happened to me

item.title: Need a bit of help
item.dc:creator: @davyn729 davyn729
item.description:
@davyn729 wrote:

"Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always"

…I need help with this part of the tutorial. When I type my router IP in the address bar, it takes me to a Google search. I need to do this part badly, or else no one will be able to get on my server! :eek:[br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2007, 07:26:31 PM[/size][hr]please

Read full topic
